intro: Mesembryanthemum berghiae, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry or African star-of-Bethleem, is a member of the Aizoaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, orange to yellow fruits that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. Mesembryanthemum berghiae is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
